docs.lead_paragraph: The leader of Germany's Turkish community on Monday accused President Tayyip Erdogan of damaging ties between the two NATO allies by likening bans on political rallies by Turks in Germany  to "fascist actions" reminiscent of Nazi times.
docs.snippet: The leader of Germany's Turkish community on Monday accused President Tayyip Erdogan of damaging ties between the two NATO allies by likening bans on political rallies by Turks in Germany  to "fascist actions" reminiscent of Nazi times....

headline.main: Germany's Turkish Community Say Erdogan Went Too Far With Nazi Comments
headline.print_headline: Germany's Turkish Community Say Erdogan Went Too Far With Nazi Comments

docs.lead_paragraph: Two days before Nigeria shuts down Abuja's airport for repairs to its dilapidated runway, workers still need to fit electrics, seating and toilets to a new terminal at Kaduna, which will handle the capital's air traffic but lacks capacity.

headline.main: Nigeria Racing to Add Capacity to Provincial Airport Before Abuja Closure
headline.print_headline: Nigeria Racing to Add Capacity to Provincial Airport Before Abuja Closure

docs.lead_paragraph: A push by Poland's eurosceptic government to remove fellow-countryman Donald Tusk from one of the top jobs in the European Union seemed to be gaining little traction as the bloc's foreign ministers met in Brussels on Monday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Spanish public debt stood at 99.26 percent of gross domestic product (GDP) at the end of 2016 according to provisional data, a Treasury source said on Monday.

docs.lead_paragraph: A former confidant of New Jersey Governor Chris Christie will be sentenced on Monday for pressuring United Airlines into operating a flight to an airport near his vacation home, a case that grew out of the "Bridgegate" investigation.

docs.lead_paragraph: The green energy car subsidiary of Chinese automaker Beijing Automotive Group [BEJINS.UL] plans an initial public offering in 2018, Chairman Xu Heyi said on Monday, adding that the unit should be profitable that year.

docs.lead_paragraph: Cruise missiles, floating mines and a remote-controlled boat have been deployed to attack ships in Yemen in recent months, changing the dynamic of the two-year-old war and pushing the country closer to famine, shipping and aid officials say.
docs.snippet: Cruise missiles, floating mines and a remote-controlled boat have been deployed to attack ships in Yemen in recent months, changing the dynamic of the two-year-old war and pushing the country closer to famine, shipping and aid officials say....

headline.main: Escalation in Ship Attacks Pushes Yemen Towards Starvation
